subject: Investing
title: The Illusion of Control
description: A fast breakdown of The Illusion of Control for builders.

hook.text: A day trader spent 14 hours watching charts, convinced more screen time meant more control over outcomes.

buildup.text: The illusion of control is believing your actions influence outcomes that are largely random.

discovery.text: Short-term stock movements are mostly noise. No amount of chart-watching changes the odds meaningfully.

twist.text: People who pick their own lottery numbers feel more confident, even though odds are identical.

climax.text: Accepting what you can't controlâ€”and focusing on what you can (costs, allocation, behavior)â€”is true mastery.

punchline.text: Control your process. The market will handle its own results.

quiz.question: What is the illusion of control?
options: Believing your actions influence random outcomes
